constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 20 (Wednesday, February 3, 2021)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mr. GALLAGHER:
H.R. 752.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
Article I, Section 8 of the U.S. Constitution
[Page H324]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Reform.

title: To amend the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 to require Federal political appointees to sign a binding ethics pledge, and for other purposes.
